name: 呂怜樺
objective: The goal of this course is to survey the major theoretical perspectives in organizational theory (OT). More specifically, we introduce the foundation questions of the strategy field and focus on the strategy ‘content” research in this class. The major purpose of this class is to expose students to samples of contemporary strategy content research and to point out some access points to the broader universe of thought on each topic. In other words, we will start from the fundamentals in order to have a solid understanding of the theoretical approach. This elaboration will be followed by a more in-depth exploration of the empirical articles assigned for each week, and how this contributes to organization theory. Finally, we will move on to the assessment and critique of the theoretical view. One or two students will be assigned to lead each week’s discussion.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction the perspective of Organization Theory
Week 2: Organization Structure
Week 3: Organization Design 
Week 4: Why we need theory   
Week 5: Session 3: Industry and competitive strategy (Transaction Cost Theory) 
Week 6: Session 4: Firm as a System of Incentives (Agency Theory) 
Week 7: Session 5: Strategic Assets and Resources within a firm (Resource-Based View (RBV) 
Week 8: TEJ Database Introduction 
Wee 9: Mid-Term Project 
Week 10: Session 6: The Knowledge Base of a Firm (Knowledge-Based View (KBV)
Week 11: Session 7: Acquire Outside Supporting (Resource Dependent Theory (RDT)
Week 12: Session 8: Network Organizations (Network Theory)
Week 13: Session 9: Evolution Theory (Evolution Theory)
Week 14: Session 10: Institutional Theory 
Week 15: Session 11: Performance Feedback as Mechanism (Behavior Theory of Firm (Search Behavior) 
Week 16: Session 11: Technological Innovation 
Week 17: Session 12: Technological Innovation-2 
Week 18: Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Leading Discussion (20% of grade)
Class Preparation and Participation (30% of grade) 
Individual Paper and Presentation (50% of grade)
